item.title: Temperature fluctuations - The Code
item.description: The tempFGN github repository contains all the material related to the paper: How does temperature vary over time? Evidence on the stationary and fractal nature of temperature by John Dagsvik, Mariachiara Fortuna, Sigmund H. Moen All the materials are stored in the form of an R package. You can download or clone the repository and install the package: then all the functions will be available for usage. The same repository contains also all the online resources available as supplementary materials together with the paper, in pdf format.

item.title: Temperature fluctuations - The Idea Behind
item.description: Usually, looking at the time series of observed temperatures, we see graphs as the one below. These graphs show the temperature fluctuations over the past 150 years, where temperatures show a systematic increase. The length of the time series is a crucial feature for understanding temperature fluctuations, because temperatures show cycles that seem to persist for several decades: so, if we want to understand the amplitude of the climate fluctuations, the limited length of the time series may compromise our understanding of the phenomena.

item.title: Temperature fluctuation paper - Main Results
item.description: This section contains all the results included in the Temperature fluctuations paper

item.title: Appendix B - Summary data information
item.description: Information on the weather stations, lenght of the related time series and missing data

item.title: Appendix C - Estimation and test results
item.description: H estimation by Whittle and Wavelet estimators. Chi square statistics and stationarity tests

item.title: Appendix D - Properties of the estimators
item.description: Properties of different estimators of the FGN models, with boostrap simulations

item.title: Appendix E - Temperature stations infographics
item.description: Infographics on 96 weather stations, with temperature fluctuations, autocorrelation and statistical tests

item.title: Appendix F - Selection procedure
item.description: Details on the selection procedure of the available temperature time series

item.title: Temperature Data
item.description: The goal of this section is to describe the data used in the Temperature Fluctuation paper and how these data are organized. All the data are available in the fgnTemp repository, and their organization strongly depend from the aim of the analysis that we have carried out. Since the goal of our work was to study the historical variations of temperature fluctuations, we needed long temperatures time series, possibly for several weather station.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Are you curious about something? Do you want a showcase of our works, or want to work with us? Let’s get in touch!
